titles.title: Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” / Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols. 1ra-13vb, 22ra-24vb, 41ra-44vb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 1ra-9ra) - On John the Evangelist as the author of the book; on the creation and the fall of the angels (fols. 1ra-4va) - Story of the family of Adam (fols. 4va-9ra) I-2) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 7 miracles (fols. 9ra-13vb, 22ra-24vb, 41ra-44vb), fols. misplaced, the end is missing. II) Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary” (fols. 14ra-21vb, 25ra-40vb, 45ra-64vb) II-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 14ra-17rb l. 1) II-2) Introductory exhortation (fols. 17rb l. 2-18va l. 7) II-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki … “I worship Thee…” (fols. 18va l. 8-20ra) II-4) Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary”: 39 miracles (fols. 20rb-21vb, 25ra-40vb, 45ra-64vb), fols. misplaced, the end is missing. II-5) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi… “Does not the man…” (distributed among the miracles of Mary, fols. 25va-40vb, 46ra-62ra).

donors.donor: The name Gäbrä Mikaʾel is written in the main hand in the supplication formulas, e.g., fol. 1ra, 22va, 34va, 64vb. Many other names are also written in the supplication formulas in the main hand: Gäbrä Mikaʾel (e.g., fol. 1ra, 13ra, 22va, 34va, 56ra, 64vb), ʾAklilä Maryam (fols. 27rb, 55vb, 56va, 63rb), Śahlä Mikaʾel (fol. 28vb), Wälättä Giyorgis (fols. 36rb, 48vb, 54va, 63rb), Wälättä Ḥǝywät (fol. 37ra).

txstates.txstate: The boards are missing. The Ms. is severely damaged with water. The sewing is destroyed and has been replaced with a vegetal thread. The Ms. has been resewn with the incorrect order of the quires. Accordingly, many fols. are misplaced, some are missing. Text on many fols. is illegible or barely legible: e.g., fols. 22va, 23rb, 24vb, 41r, 44v, 61r.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible at the spine fold of the quires, close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire:
I(10/fols. 1r-10v) – II(6/fols. 11r-13v, 22r-24v) – III(8/fols. 14r-21v) – IV(8/fols. 25r-32v) – V(8/fols. 33r-40v) – VI(4/fols. 41r-44v) – VII(8/fols. 45r-52v) – VIII(8/fols. 53r-60v) – IX(4/fols. 61r-64v).
Quire III has been inserted into the centrefold of quire II.

taunit.rl-info:
Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The scribe did not used the last ruled line on fols. 1r-3v.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; several lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1 and II-4, alternating with black lines; two groups of lines on the incipit page of Text II-1; two lines on the incipit page of Text II-3, alternating with a black line; two initial lines of each miracle of Text I-2, II-4; two initial lines of Text II-2; first word of each strophe of Text II-5; elements of the punctuation signs, text dividers and Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Numeration of the miracles in Text I is inconsistent: Text I-1 has been treated by the scribe as miracles 1-3, but miracle no. 2 in Text I-2 has been numbered 6 etc. - Text II-3 includes the hymn: ʾƎsäggǝd läki ʾƎsäggǝd läki ʾƎsäggǝd läki (fols. 19va-20ra). - Miracles 1-3 and 33 of Text II-4 are not numbered. Number 27 has been omitted. - Text II-5 comprises 30 strophes which are strophes 1-13, 15-25, 27-32 according to GrohHymn pp. 336-53. - Two leaves from MM-014 (fols. 1rv and 8rv) originally belonged to this Ms.

extras.extra: - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of two perpendicular lines (┴), indicating the place where the omissions, written in the upper margin, belong: fol. 3vb. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally, possibly in the main hand: e.g., fols. 2ra, 4ra, 17va. - Omitted letter added at the end of the line: fol. 12ra. - Erasure on fol. 33rb. - Corrections written over erasures in the main hand: e.g., fols. 46vb, 50rb, 50va. - Numbers of the miracles have been written in the left margin in the main hand: e.g., fols. 7va, 13ra, 27rb, 34rb, 40vb, 52rb. - Scribbles in blue pen on fol. 2ra. - Three crosses in red ink, outlined in black, are written in the intercolumn of the incipit page of Text II-1.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Readings are indicated by the names of the days, written in in then main hand, in frames, in the upper margin: ዘእኁድ፡: fol. 1ra ዘዓርብ፡: fol 4va.

frames.frame: Fol. 14r (incipit page of Text II): coloured (red, mostly faded away) band; geometric motifs.
